citations.desc: Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries.
citations.narrative:
The facility's records required to be kept by the Animal Welfare Act, including the written program of veterinary care and
the contingency plan, were not able to be examined today. The licensee states he had given them to his veterinarian after
the previous inspection (completed 9/6/22) for review and updating by the attending veterinarian. The licensee has not
followed up with the vet to have them returned to the facility. Records required by the Act must be kept available for
review by APHIS officials during business hours in order to allow for compliance inspections and to guide the licensee in
the care of the facility's animals. The licensee shall have records required by the Act available to allow APHIS officials to
examine the records. Correct by 3/31/23.

The horizontal metal bars of the indoor capuchin enclosures in the back capuchin building are rusty. The capuchins have
contact with these bars. The painted coating over the metal has flaked off and the metal has become rusted and
rough/pitted on the surface. These rusty surfaces can no longer be adequately cleaned and sanitized and over time the
rust will affect the structural strength of the metal. The facility shall maintain all metal surfaces in contact with the
nonhuman primates free of excessive rust. Correct by 05/31/23.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
End Section

narrative:
2.126(a)(2) 
   
Access and inspection of records and property; submission of itineraries. 
The facility's records required to be kept by the Animal Welfare Act, including the written program of veterinary care and 
the contingency plan, were not able to be examined today. The licensee states he had given them to his veterinarian after 
the previous inspection (completed 9/6/22) for review and updating by the attending veterinarian. The licensee has not 
followed up with the vet to have them returned to the facility. Records required by the Act must be kept available for 
review by APHIS officials during business hours in order to allow for compliance inspections and to guide the licensee in 
the care of  the facility's animals. The licensee shall have records required by the Act available to allow APHIS officials to 
examine the records. Correct by 3/31/23. 
3.75(c)(1)(i) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
The horizontal metal bars of the indoor capuchin enclosures in the back capuchin building are rusty. The capuchins have 
contact with these bars. The painted coating over the metal has flaked off and the metal has become rusted and 
rough/pitted on the surface. These rusty surfaces can no longer be adequately cleaned and sanitized and over time the 
rust will affect the structural strength of the metal. The facility shall maintain all metal surfaces in contact with the 
nonhuman primates free of excessive rust. Correct by 05/31/23.

This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
End Section
